titles: Bee patient in trouble: or, The patient mans counsell wherein is showne the great goodness of God towards them that beare the crosses and afflictions of this world patiently: as also a friendly instruction, whereby to advise us to forsake our wonted sinnes, and turne unto the Lord by speedy repentance, very meete and necessary for the worldlings to marke, reade, heare, and make use of. To the tune of, Bodkins Galliard.
author: L. P. (Laurence Price), fl. 1625-1680?
publisher: for Iohn Wright junior, dwelling at the upper end of the Old Baily,
notes: Verse - "Come, come, you greedy worldlings leave your toyle,".
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.
